title: tso1009
author: tso1009
content: Hi everyone! Here is a website I've been working on that shows crypto news, crypto graphs, and even a bitcoin explorer with live global transactions. The graphs are still elementary, but looking for feedback/  thoughts from people who like to follow crypto! Thanks https://d2index.com/

comments.author: mendace
comments.body: Hey, not bad I like your theme, if I may ask: How did you make it?  Did you use wordpress or other CMD or just with html and ccs? Another curiosity, what is the use of registering on your site?  What benefits will you get?  I see there is a log in button.

comments.author: tso1009
comments.body: Hi @mendace - the website was made using React and node.js API. the login will be used to eventually save bitcoin wallets that you can set notifications on. Thank you for your feedback!

comments.author: Tanvi50_
comments.body: Here are some suggestions to make your website a bit more clean looking. As it is now, it's not bad but there are room to improve.And clicking on any news opens up a new tab which for me is a bit annoying. You can put a preview of the news and then add a button in the end of it maybe saying Read more or View full storylike this  Read moreHope this help.

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: I must admit that the site looks interesting, has minimal design and works quite fast. it certainly seems that it is still unfinished and there are still many possibilities for upgrading.I have to ask you what is the main goal you want to achieve with this site. do you actually want to make a portfolio where you show your developer skills or is it still a training ground for testing knowledge from React and Node.js? not sure why you need a news page, adding new news requires a lot of additional work, and the competition is extremely high. rather focus on other things, a more functional explorer and be more user-friendly.edit: here is a good example that a site can be interesting as a service without news. Check bitmover's site https://bitcoindata.science/index.html

comments.author: gunhell16
comments.body: Honestly, it's well-organized, and I like its interface too. It doesn't hurt my eyes or vision, this is just my opinion. What is it, are you one of the creators of this website or are you part of the team that created it?But even so, if I look at this site platform that you provided, it is like a type of crypto news platform, with other features that are also shown to the community here on the forum. But I think it still needs a little repair and improvement to be perfect.

comments.author: goldkingcoiner
comments.body: Quote from: tso1009 on December 13, 2022, 08:05:30 PMHi everyone! Here is a website I've been working on that shows crypto news, crypto graphs, and even a bitcoin explorer with live global transactions. The graphs are still elementary, but looking for feedback/  thoughts from people who like to follow crypto! Thanks https://d2index.com/Just from the first look it seems like an interesting site but might need some improvements.A few things I recommend: The interface itself is a bit lacking in the user experience design area. I would add some "sneak peeks" or summed-up information whenever you hover your cursor over the news, charts, etc. area on the right top side. Also, right top? Seems a bit out of place. Our eyes naturally go to the first thing on the left. Furthermore, whenever you click on an article it opens a new tab. That is a bit irritating. On the bottom you should put FAQ, contact info, social media links and so on.When you click the articles, it sends you to different news sites? No original content? Not sure how that is going to be viewed by the original writers, especially if you do not have permission to use their articles.

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: In principle, the site is beautiful and fast to load on the browser. It has a simple and well-designed interface, but I was surprised that the news headlines are linked to external sites and not to pages within the site!!! As if you are free advertising for these news sites!!Also for bitcoin browser it seems not to work. I pasted the address of bitcoin and TX but I didn't get any results even though it shows a message that the download is 100%!!I waited for a longer time, but I did not get any results. I do not know if it is not complete yet, or is there something wrong?

comments.author: Wiwo
comments.body: Ops I must commend your effort even though the site will need some improvement in the area of graphic quality, but the site functions work just fine, I tried the BTC explorer and it work just fine. So in general the site is an awesome work and I applaud you to keep developing it since it is a crypto news site and will require constant updates.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: I think you tried to make it similar to cryptowat.ch which is a good thing because I like the interface presented on that site, but the final output was not ideal.The interface is beautiful as an idea, but the implementation still needs a lot of work. The important thing now is to focus on the content. Do you have a better way to analyze the content?Instead of focusing on the view?Also, the response of the site is somewhat slow.

comments.author: SFR10
comments.body: @tso1009I get that it's an aggregator, but you need to place different things into different categories [as things stand, videos and news/articles are grouped together (e.g. here's one)].You might want to add various filters for the news tab...A button to switch between day and night mode.There should also be an automated system in place for getting rid of duplicate or similar content.

comments.author: Beparanf
comments.body: The layout looks great but I just want a portion for a trending news category so that reader can determine hot news from the typical news. The format and idea is identical to cryptopanic and the only difference was you add the image per article which is great. Maybe add some feature that let reader react and comment anonymously for a possible interaction to your website.Typically news aggregator like that display live price on the top part of the website to let reader know the crypto price while reading news since some people love to check price frequently.

comments.author: virasog
comments.body: Quote from: tso1009 on December 13, 2022, 08:05:30 PMHi everyone! Here is a website I've been working on that shows crypto news, crypto graphs, and even a bitcoin explorer with live global transactions. The graphs are still elementary, but looking for feedback/  thoughts from people who like to follow crypto! Thanks https://d2index.com/I decided to visit your site and here is my initial feedback. On the home page, i saw some news. At first, i thought these news were written by your site authors but by clicking on them I realized that they take to the respective crypto news site. Well, it is good for anyone who wants to get glimpse of crypto news at once but I think it is not good for your site as it takes people to other sites and they won't spend time on your site. With this apporach, you may get difficult to generate revenue when you monetize your site.My suggestion will be to read the news from those sites and try to reproduce them in your own site.Now coming to the charts section, i thought i may get some customized charts for bitcoin but was disappointed to see charts which no real value. Would it be good if you can include onchian charts or other charts which offer some customization, like trading view charts explaining the movement of bitcoin and ethereum?Just take my feedback as positive, i am delighted to see that you have started the site and hope you will continuously improve it.

comments.author: Saisher
comments.body: I thought it was an article site and you are writing these articles it's actually a news aggregator, not bad its easy to create a site like this because you don't have to provide your own content.My recommendation are Put your logo above  the title and tagline I notice you already have a logo because you have a favicon installed in the browser to identify your site which is goodTake down the login link it has no purpose being thereCreate categories so visitors will have a choice of categories that they are interested in.

comments.author: BigBos
comments.body: Hello, I used my phone to visit your website, as seen in the screenshot,You made it well and the view also appealed to me, but the action button is too big so it covers most of my mobile screen, my suggestion maybe you should make it a little smaller so that visitors/users using mobile phones are more comfortable.But overall your Web design is very good and of course I am also interested in using your website to monitor bitcoin price movementsThank you.

comments.author: fortunecrypto
comments.body: Besides the absence of a logo I recommend that you create a page for what the site is all about, it could be a page or a pop-up to fully explain what the site is all about, the most important on any site is returning visitors so I recommend if the script can, to install follow me on social account specifically for your site, and Mailchimp is offering a free plan for a subscription so having subscribers will notify your followers for new content.

comments.author: Mr. Magkaisa
comments.body: Quote from: tso1009 on December 13, 2022, 08:05:30 PMHi everyone! Here is a website I've been working on that shows crypto news, crypto graphs, and even a bitcoin explorer with live global transactions. They must also categorize if what you will update the crypto community here on your platform is about trading, innovations of cryptocurrency, etc.

comments.author: bittraffic
comments.body: The site seems to be just pulling articles from everywhere. Is this done automatically I guess? Somehow I did something like this with wordpress plugins but yours is using heroku right? In the light of SEO, your site may not gain from organic searches. You haven't created an article that is unique that can only be found on your site.Anyway, it's clean so far there isn't an ad yet that you insert on it. How do you intend to monetize a site like this?

comments.author: NdaMk
comments.body: The site appears to be well-organized and well-designed. It's simple to use and very quick to access. When I looked at the cryptocurrency charts, there were only two coins displayed with little information about them. You should include more information in that area; it will be extremely beneficial to obtain real-time information from visitors visiting the site for the first time in order to entice them to return again and again. I think you did an excellent job and applaud your efforts.

comments.author: akreyad10
comments.body: Happy to see a beautiful responsive website what you have built. But I think you should add button with border and give some hover effect when someone put his/her cursor on button. Your all setup was top-notch, I just give some suggestion as a Web Developer
